subject: Testing GUI Classes with no X-Display

messageBody:
Hello,

I am using junit to test some AWT based UI classes that are used in an applet.
Under Windows, everything works just fine. When I move over to unix, things
are ok so long as I am running a X-Display Server. If I don't then strange
classloading exceptions start being thrown. All of my non-gui unit tests
still run fine of course.

This would be ok except that I run a daily build every night from cron
that does a checkout, compile, and unit test. This unit tests for the GUI
classes fail because there is no X-Display attached. My current solutions
are:
1. Only run GUI tests on windows (works, but lame)
2. Create a "fake" X-Display on unix so the GUI tests can run
(I have no idea how to do this)
3. Something else I didn't think of

Has anybody else run into this sort of thing? If so, how did you approach
a soltion?

Also of note, the GUI unit tests do not actually display anything. They
create, manipulate, add/remove AWT components but never actually write
anything to the Display (and therefore don't read from the Display
so I don't need any features like java.awt.Robot or anything).

Thanks,

--
